		Question: what art movement did leonardo da vinci belong to
		Answer:
answer:
Leonardo Da Vinci was a member of the Florentine Renaissance.

The Florentine Renaissance, which lasted from the late 14th to the 17th century. Florence was the heart of the Renaissance during this time, as it was the center of commerce, religion, and art.
